author: ankur2534
content: Question after last all-core-devs: Why are we constrained to a June/July merge by the current difficulty bomb? If block times are at 20s in August, couldn't we just ask miners to increase block gaslimits to 40-45m to compensate? I understand that there's a speed and time-to-inclusion/finality impact with very long blocktimes, but I would think we could use block gaslimit to give ourselves a bigger window if needed

author: m.kalinin
content: I tend to agree but first we need to ensure that making LVH optional for when EL is `SYNCING` is safe in all cases. When EL isn't `SYNCING` it must set LVH in the case when multiple blocks have been executed as a part of re-org to let CL know which of these blocks are invalid and must be discarded. For clients that runs execution on `newPayload` and doesn't do this on `fcU` LVH looks redundant as it's always gonna be set to a parent block in this case.

author: m.kalinin
content: Playing with gas limit is potentially dangerous thing. And it can't help with the bomb as when the bomb starts to blow up avg block time tends to increase exponentially and it would require constant adjustment of gas limit -- an entirely unsafe option.
